resources.string: 8471 Pacific Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, CA 92651

Finding a piece of the beach that is so clean and pristineâ€¦ Taking one back to the 40s is a delight. It is right in the middle of California Pacific Highway crowds and yet it is a step back in time. The restaurant had great food and an ambiance that matched that long ago quiet while listening to the waves and watching the sea birds.

There are only a few towns in the Gold Coast that reach the level of Newport Beach. The beaches are the best. The restaurants are unbelievable in style and taste. Some of the best shopping in California. Gelson\'s Market is the best market in Orange County. You will not see more exotic cars anywhere. You have to go through the harbor for a cruise and see the biggest display of private yachts and water front homes in California. If you are here during Christmas a restaurant view of the parade of lights is a must. This town is the Gem of the Gold Coast.

The only beach that isn\'t crowded in the City of Laguna Beach. The local people will direct you to Aliso Beach further south if you have trouble finding it. They don\'t want to give up their best kept secret. Parking is almost non-existent, but available on PCH and across PCH off Nye\'s Pl. There is even an underpass below PCH to get back to the south side of PCH. Look for thick metal walkway rails leading down to the beach between houses. It looks private, but it\'s a state beach, all are welcome! Best tip, get there very early and enjoy the day!
24300 Dana Point Harbor Drive, Dana Point, CA 92629â€“2914

This beach is perfect for young kids and toddlers. It\'s a protected section of the marina (no need to worry about high waves or undertow) with a roped off area for a max depth less than about 18-24\" in high tide. Car parking is right beside the beach so not too far to lug beach items. Restrooms adjacent to the beach and quite well maintained. There are Rentals right at the beach for SUP boards, kayaks and more!
18331 E Pacific Coast Hwy, Huntington Beach, CA 92648
Bolsa Chica state beach has fun for all. Great beaches with good facilities. Lifeguards on duty for your safety. Nice place to sit and stare out at the beautiful ocean! Family friendly.
E Pacific Coast Hwy and Goldenwest St, Huntington Beach, CA 92648

This is a great beach to take your dog. While your dog runs around playing with friends you can enjoy a walk on a very beautiful beach. There are free bags you can use to pick up after your dog. Easy access to the beach from the very convenient partaking lot on Pacific Coast Highway.
Pacific Coast Hwy, Dana Point, CA 92629

Easy parking, convenient walk down the hill and there is a beach shuttle for a buck if you do not feel like walking back up the hill with friendly drivers who bring you to your car. There is a wonderful walkway and the beach is just fabulous, a must visit!
31972 Pacific Coast Hwy, Laguna Beach, CA 92651

A fun and great workout if you\'re challenging yourself for a climb up these stairs. Beautiful Laguna with its beach breeze and sun will give you the motivation to complete the task. It\'s not 1000, but it will seem like it once you\'ve gone up those stairs a few times. Many have come to challenge themselves by going up these steps over 5 or 10 times. Give it a try and enjoy the beach and waves and sunset afterwards.

SB is smaller than some of the surrounding beach towns. But it\'s well worth a visit. The beach is nice and is perfect to watch the sun set. There\'s a shopping area and plenty of restaurants. Paid parking is available or if you\'re lucky, you may find free parking. Have fun!
Corona del Mar State Beach, 3001 Ocean Blvd, Corona Del Mar, CA 92625

The beach itself is beautiful and there are ample reviews already. But, look up to the cliff side and hike up. It is a beautiful view from the cliff above either overseeing the beach or the architecture of the homes. Plenty of street parking if one prefer to drive up but do show respects for the local residents for they are the ones who provide us with this scenic street.

More than a year on, the Buena Park location of Porto\'s Bakery & Cafe continues to thrive. This massive outlet for Cuban baked goods and savory-side stuff is as slammed as it gets most days, with folks lining up for potato balls and whatever else they can get their hands on.
185 W. Center Street Promenade, Anaheim, CA, 92805

Jimmy Martinez continues the Anaheim dining revolution with Pour Vida Latin Flavor, his casual corner spot with small outdoor seating and big flavors. It\'s a hit with the walking crowd that passes by out front, and has helped to establish Martinez as one of Orange County\'s most recognizable chef names.

Garlic and Chives is a certifiable Little Saigon hit. The strip mall space continues to draw legions of fans, eager to try the varied Vietnamese fare, from seafood specialities to soups to noodles on down.
410 N Bristol St, Santa Ana, CA 92703

Burritos La Palma is a Mexican food institution around the Southland, known for palm-sized wrapped tacos filled with slowly-braised meats. Simplicity rules here, with diners lining up to catch three, four, or more of the hefty mini-burritos at a clip for one seriously filling lunch or early dinner.

Carlos Salgado rightfully continues to earn accolades for his upscale modern Mexican restaurant at the OC Mix Mart, which â€” besides being delicious â€” actively seeks out pre-Hispanic ingredients and heirloom products to work with. Taco Maria is, in many ways, still helping to change the way Orange County thinks about Mexican food.
695 Town Center Dr Suit 160, Costa Mesa, CA 92626

Vaca remains a dining destination for Orange County, thanks to chef Amar Santana\'s stint on Top Chef. The Spanish-inflected Costa Mesa restaurant hits on all cylinders, from meat to seafood to fresh produce to one of the best wine lists in the county.

Costa Mesa dinner and lounge option Mesa is a special kind of place, with its inviting interior and wide array of shareable items. Everything is comforting and approachable but done with love, including the craft beer and boutique wine list that attracts a weekend crowd.
2937 Bristol St Ste D100A, Costa Mesa, CA 92626
One of Orange County\'s finest bake shops, this Costa Mesa pastry institution now serves Santa Ana and San Diego as well. Breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dessert are all on the table here.
Upscale Oo Toro Sushi is a hit for the spendy faction of Irvine, working a menu of top notch fish and decadent add-ons like Wagyu beef from a clean, slick space off Michelson Drive.
21010 Pacific Coast Hwy, Huntington Beach, CA 92648

Blackhouse Hospitality has pushed into Orange County in a big way with LSXO, the glitzy newcomer to the large Pacific City project in Huntington Beach. Hidden away inside sister restaurant Bluegold, LSXO is a 28-seat high end option working a decidedly clever Southeast Asian menu.

Experience the thrill of the an old wooden rollercoaster, but with modern twists, turns and technology, at "California Screamin." Or enjoy a live performance by your favorite characters at Disney\'s newest theme park, featuring a slew of exciting rides and family entertainment.

Once a working berry farm, this popular theme park is now home to GhostRider, the world\'s best wooden roller coaster; Supreme Scream, a ride where participants are hoisted up 30-stories and dropped down in three seconds; the Xcelerator, rated the world\'s best launch coaster and Camp Snoopy, home to the beloved Peanuts gang.

Adventure City is the little theme park that\'s big on family fun! Admission for a family of four is less than a ticket to a big park so you can enjoy all of our 17 rides, shows and attractions for one affordable price! Experience thrills on one of our two roller coasters including our newest coaster, Rewind Racers. North America\'s first forward and reversing family shuttle coaster. Take a ride on the Adventure City Express Train for a scenic trip around the park or get a little loony on the crazy bus. Meet some new animal friends in our petting farm. Enjoy fun, interactive children\'s shows and so much more! Adventure City, Orange County\'s premier destination for affordable family fun!

When it comes to fun, Boomers! Is a blast! Whether you\'re celebrating a birthday, having a party, doing corporate parties, events and team building, or spending quality time with family and friends, Boomers makes everything easier and hassle free. With attractions like Batting Cages, Thrill Rides, Miniature Golf, Go Karts, Bumper Boats, Laser Tag, Rock Wall, Arcade, King Arthur\'s Carnival and Lil\' Thunder Road, Boomers is the perfect place for fun! It\'s a super-sized water play area that\'s five levels high with slippery slides, wet tunnels, spray loops and a huge splash bucket. Make the fun happen with spray cannons and the interactive aqua dome. This new water play park includes over 1000 feet of water slides. And if you just want to watch the action, kick back in a comfy lounge chair.
100 Universal City Plaza, Universal City, CA 91608

Find a full day of action-packed entertainment all in one place: thrilling Theme Park rides and shows, a real working movie studio, and Los Angeles\' best shops, restaurants and cinemas at CityWalk. Universal Studios Hollywood is a unique experience that\'s fun for the whole family.

The Great Wolf Lodge Southern California is California\'s first indoor waterpark. This 603 room hotel incorporates a 121,000 square foot indoor water park, making it the largest Great Wolf Lodge resort in existence. The resort gives visitors the option to stay in a themed suite, allowing you to huddle in the wolf\'s den or cozy up in a cabin themed suite. This hotel is perfect for a variety of family friendly activities. Families can be a part of a lunch time line up of activities and play at the indoor waterpark. Entrance to the indoor water park is included in hotel rates and is exclusively offered to hotel guest. The waterpark has over 15 attractions and activities that are the epitome of aquatic fun.
Sand Canyon & Marine Drive, Irvine CA 92869

Hundreds of thousands of visitors from all over Southern California enjoy the Orange County Great Park\'s current array of recreational and educational opportunities, including views from the iconic Great Park Balloon that rises 400 feet in the air and provides a panoramic view of Orange County. Other Great Park features include the Carousel, Farm + Food Lab, Kids Rock Playground, Walkable Historical Timeline, Palm Court Arts Complex, North Lawn recreation area and historic Hangar 244. The Great Park also hosts a variety of special events that provide unique experiences for the entire family, including the Growing the Park Anniversary Celebration, annual Pumpkin Harvest, Great Night! Family New Year\'s Eve, Flights & Sounds Summer Festival and the weekly Great Park Farmers Market.
2647 Pacific Coast Hwy, Newport Beach, CA 92625
Horticultural retreat that features a museum of living plants, walking paths, bubbling tile fountains and a library devoted to the study of the Pacific Southwest.
5 Riparian View, Irvine CA 92612, Irvine, CA 92612

Go before sunset and watch all the birds flying in from the surrounding area. There are an unbelievable number of birds in this man-made wetlands on the grounds of a water reclamation plant. The paths are flat (but dirt) and easy to walk around the different pools. There are several parking lots along Riparian Way and at sunset you will see photographers taking photos. There are surprises at every turn. Birds fill the sky, Pelicans on a island, egrets, birds of prey, ducks, American coots, Red Eye Western Grebe, lots of wading birds including black neck stilts and white face ibis. You will see an amazing variety of birds and very few people on a weekday around sunset. It\'s a hidden gem!

Whiting Ranch Wilderness Park encompasses approximately 2,500 acres of riparian and oak woodland canyons, rolling grassland hills and steep slopes of coastal sage scrub and chaparral. The park is highlighted by scenic rock formations, including the beautiful Red Rock Canyon. There are three intermittent streams: Borrego, Serrano and Aliso Creek meandering through the park, each hosting an abundance of wildlife. Remnants of the former cattle ranching days can be seen throughout the park.

Rancho Las Lomas Wildlife Foundation is an open-air museum that lives, breathes, squawks and growls. Our dedication is to educate and inspire the community about the wonders of the natural world, while helping all realize every creature of this planet deserves the right to live with compassion and respect.

Bolsa Chica is a small area just North of Huntington Beach Dog Back on Pacific Coast Highway that provides visitors an opportunity to observe, photograph and relax in a little oasis on the way to Seal Beach in California. There is a small parking lot connecting to Pacific Coast Highway. After exiting your vehicle, you notice a walkway to the North that is paved. Directly ahead is a wooden sturdy bridge leading to the opposite bank. Water in the pool has direct access to the Pacific Ocean. As the tide comes in, the water level increases. Ocean birds congregate in the protected area. There is no hunting or fishing within this area. There you will find an abundance of photographers. The scope and variety of birds will keep you excited about what you will see next. There are also sea animals that may enter and leave at will. It is a nice place to unplug from the civilization for a while.

Riley park is a very nice park just to take a break and unwind. There are a few trails that do have an encline that will get your legs and heart working. Once on top the view is very much worth it! The park is well maintained with an Interpretive Center that holds much of the parks history.
800 Seal Beach Blvd, Seal Beach, CA 90740â€“5607

The National Wildlife Refuge in Seal Beach offers opportunities to see what is being done to protect our endangered species and wetlands, conservation efforts to protect native habitat, and raise awareness about the human impact on our environment. A tour of the Refuge is offered on the last Saturday of the month (as noted in the Seal Beach Sun). The tour is interesting and eye-opening and well worth the time. It is especially good for school groups, clubs, scouts, and community members who want to learn about wildlife and environmental issues. When you travel on PCH, a section of the highway between Seal Beach and Sunset Beach has been adopted by the Friends of the Refugeâ€”another indication of the concern the Refuge volunteers have for our local environment. Participate and support the efforts of the Seal Beach National Wildlife Refuge!
20612 Laguna Canyon Rd, Laguna Beach, CA 92651

The Pacific Marine Mammal Center rescues, rehabilitates and releases marine mammals and inspires ocean stewardship through research, education and collaboration. We are open to the public for visitors every day from 10am - 4pm. We are closed on Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Years Day. There is no charge for visiting us, but donations are appreciated!

Peters Canyon Regional Park is a beautiful hiking park. The trails are well developed with use. It is rare to find yourself alone on the trails - they are much used and much loved. The hikes offer a variety of levels so read the maps in the parking lot. The lake has been dry for a few years, but when the lake is full, your hike will feel like you have found Heaven. The parking lot is small. You can park in the neighborhoods around Peter\'s Canyon Park, but be respectful of homeowners and their property. Pack a snack and hike to the highest point in the park. You\'ll be thrilled with the find of a park bench and one BEAUTIFUL view of OC. This is a hiking park you don\'t want to miss.

It\'s one of the few natural resources left in the area. Enjoy the local flora and fauna and some nature in a place that has been heavily developed. Local school kids know this well as the best place to get your bug collection for the school science project.
